intro: Caesia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy caesia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and wetlands. Its leaves are finely divided and hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. Caesia hirsuta is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for pollinators.
